# send(_:toPeers:with:)

**Instance Method**

Transmits a collection of bytes to a list of connected peers.

## Declaration

```swift
func send(_ data: Data!, toPeers peers: [Any]!, with mode: GKSendDataMode) throws
```

## Parameters

- **data**: The bytes to be sent.
- **peers**: An array of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSString] objects identifying the peers that should receive the data.
- **mode**: The mechanism used to send the data.

## Discussion

The session queues the data and transmits it in the order it was queued. Data transmitted unreliably may be received out of order by the other peers.



## Working with Connected Peers

- **setDataReceiveHandler(_:withContext:)**: Sets the object that handles data received from other peers connected to the session.
- **sendData(toAllPeers:with:)**: Transmits a collection of bytes to all connected peers.
- **disconnectTimeout**: A time interval that expresses how long the session waits before it disconnects a nonresponsive peer.
- **disconnectFromAllPeers()**: Disconnects the session from all connected peers.
- **disconnectPeer(fromAllPeers:)**: Disconnects a connected peer from all peers connected to the session.
